alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 18 at 5:05AM HST until February 18 at 7:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 630 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 504 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over windward portions of Maui, with rainfall especially persistent near Hana. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kahului, Makawao, Pukalani, Haliimaile, Haiku-Pauwela, Kula, Pauwela, Paia, Huelo, Puunene, Keanae, Wailuku, Nahiku, Waiehu, Waikapu, Waihee, Kipahulu, Kahakuloa, Hana and Honokohau. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 630 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. A Flood Watch is also in effect.
